title: What should I put in the blank space?' At first I (…) starting work so early but this has changed.'A) 'didn't use to' or B) 'wasn't used to' - Quora

response.answer_text: Your “A” option isn’t correct because you need the infinitive “to start”, not the gerund “starting”. So the correct sentence would be: “At first, I didn’t use to start work so early, but this has changed.” And it’s just the opposite for your “B: choice. You need the gerund “starting” not the infinitive “to start”. So the correct sentence would be: “At first, I wasn’t used to starting work so early, but this has changed.” And there’s a subtle difference in meaning. Your first sentence is describing how your behavior changed, But your second sentence is expressing that starting work so early was very unfamiliar to you.
